alert.note: Alert for Oregon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 9:58AM CST until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of east central and south central Missouri, including the following counties, in east central Missouri, Phelps. In south central Missouri, Dent, Howell, Oregon, Shannon and Texas. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 958 AM CST, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the advisory area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323, Mahans Creek at County Road 501, Gladden Creek at County Road 624, Big Creek at County Road 390, Dry Fork Creek at County Road 2430, Meramec River at Spur Road and Piney Creek at County Road 228. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salem, Thayer, Winona, Alton, Birch Tree, Eminence, Summersville, Bunker, Koshkonong, Montier, Thomasville, Alley Spring, West Eminence, Round Spring, Teresita, Akers, Midridge, Gladden, Greer, Jadwin, Turtle, Montauk, Darien, Rover, Wilderness, Stone Hill, Couch, Howes, Lenox, Bangert, Myrtle, Sligo, Anutt, Lake Spring, Lecoma, Ozark National Scenic Riverways, Echo Bluff State Park, Current River State Park, Montauk State Park and Grand Gulf State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
